author: Chris Bascombe
title: Liverpool midfielder Adam Lallana's new deal to keep him at Anfield until 2021
text:
A dam Lallana will sign his new Liverpool contract on Wednesday, keeping him at Anfield until 2021.
Talks between Lallana's representatives and Liverpool were concluded on Tuesday night ahead of putting pen to paper on Wednesday. A formal announcement is expected on Wednesday night or Thursday morning.
An initial three-year deal has a further one-year option. Liverpool are indicating a salary nearer £110,000 a week following the completion of negotiations, although with incentives far more can be earned should the club achieve certain targets – regularly the case in current deals.
Lallana will be 32 by the time his new terms end, meaning he will now spend his peak years at Anfield.
Lallana joined Liverpool from Southampton for £25 million in 2014, and after a tough start under Brendan Rodgers has elevated his game and role under the leadership of Jürgen Klopp .
Lallana is expected to commit his future to the club Credit: GETTY IMAGES T he 28-year-old has thrived under Klopp, especially when deployed in a deeper midfield role earlier this season. He is also a key player for his country, sure to be essential to Gareth Southgate’s rebuilding process towards the next World Cup .
Klopp has wanted Lallana tied down as he sees him as the foundation of the side he is building, the attacker one of the most influential players on and off the park at Anfield nowadays.
Liverpools Premier League goalkeepers ranked from worst to best B oth at the end of last season and the start of this one, no-one in the country was performing as consistently as Lallana. An untimely injury while on international duty with England in November upset his rhythm, and that – not coincidentally – was when Liverpool’s stopped producing their free-flowing football with the same thrilling regularity.
Nevertheless, Lallana remains one of Klopp’s chief lieutenants and there was no question he would commit to the club having settled in the region and built such a trusted relationship with the manager.
